title: Primary Postulates of the Standard Model as Consequences of the Composite Nature of the Fundamental Fermions
abstract: A field model of two-component fermions is described, the consequences of which coincide in the main with primary postulates of the standard model. Such a model can be constructed for 4 generations at the minimum. Peculiarities of the relative coordinate space, determining in general an internal symmetry group, are considered. Analogues of the Higgs fields appear in the model naturally after transition to the Grassmannian extra coordinates.
